title: 103_hr867
content: The "Federal Emergency Management Agency Sunset Act of 1993" transfers all functions, powers, and duties of the Director of the Federal Emergency Management Agency to the Secretary of Defense under the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act. The transfer of authority takes effect 90 days after the enactment of the Act. The personnel, assets, liabilities, contracts, property, records, and funds related to functions transferred by the "Federal Emergency Management Agency Sunset Act of 1993" are to be transferred to the Secretary of Defense for appropriate allocation. Unexpended funds must be used for their originally authorized purpose. The Director of the Office of Management and Budget is authorized to facilitate transfers between the Federal Emergency Management Agency and the Secretary of Defense, including resolving disputes and making necessary determinations. The Director of the Federal Emergency Management Agency and the Secretary of Defense are required to jointly plan for the orderly transfer of functions and personnel as per the Act. The Act requires the Director of the Federal Emergency Management Agency and the Secretary of Defense to jointly plan for the orderly transfer of functions and personnel. This has an effect on personnel. Employees transferred to the Department of Defense from the merit pay system under chapter 54 of title 5, United States Code, will have their pay adjusted according to section 5402. Merit pay determinations will be based on performance appraisals from both the Federal Emergency Management Agency and the new agency. The Secretary of Defense can use F.E.M.A. personnel with consent from the Director. Defense is authorized to use FEMA personnel for a period of time to facilitate the transfer of functions. SEC. 5. SAVING PROVISIONS. Existing orders, determinations, rules, regulations, and agreements issued by the President, agencies, or courts in functions transferred by the Act will remain in effect until modified or revoked by the Secretary of Defense or authorized officials. Pending financial assistance applications will not be affected by the transfers of functions. Financial assistance applications pending at the time of function transfers will not be affected. Any ongoing suits related to transferred functions will continue as if the transfer had not occurred. No suits against officers of the Federal Emergency Management Agency will be dismissed due to function transfers. (e) Any cause of action by or against the Federal Emergency Management Agency, or its officers, will not be affected by function transfers. If the agency is involved in a suit related to a transferred function, it will continue with the Secretary of Defense. References to the agency in federal law will now refer to the Department of Defense for transferred functions. The Secretary of Defense has the same authority as the Director of the Federal Emergency Management Agency for transferred functions. Operational continuity is a key consideration in exercising transferred functions.
